website_summaries.verdict: Parents and teachers looking for a learning stool that adjusts alongside kids' growth should check out this high-end model.
pros: Base is curved and non-slip, allowing children to tilt stool from side to side
cons: Not the greatest option for younger children, as this stool is very high

website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch ergonomic stool that offers a non-slip, curved base and a wide range of motion.
pros: Lightweight design makes it easy to move and store the stool
Wide seat offers plenty of space
Pneumatic gas lift makes it simple to adjust the seat height
Sold in a variety of eye-catching seat colors to match any setting's decor
cons: Stool may be difficult to assemble

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. My kids and I use this everyday. I have recommended it to many people. Easy to adjust. Easy to move around. wobbles great and spins too. My kids work a lot longer while on here. I choose to use it for computer tasks, sewing tasks anything. It is really great! In the second picture my hand is in a little groove, this makes it sooo easy to carry one handed anywhere! I use it all the time! You can also see the buttons to raise and lower it.
customer_reviews.author: Spark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I got a different one of these for my son, who has a hard time sitting at a desk. I got this one for myself to try it out. I was surprised at how much I like it. I tend to tilt forward while typing, and this seat keeps the padding tilted with me. Being able to rotate and tilt makes it easier to reach everything around me. This also takes up less space than my previous roller chair, and it's easier to get up without having to roll back to make room. The construction is pretty sturdy, and assembly is pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Relieves Back Pain
customer_reviews.text: This helps me with my herniated disc pain. The leaning takes the pressure off my back, and I am so thankful... I can sit again! I love using it at my standing desk and dining table. I plan on getting one more when my budget allows. Good quality! ...5 stars!! Attached Picture: desk height 35.55" and I am 5'7" tall (I wish there was something for the car.)
customer_reviews.author: wildwing

customer_reviews.title: So far I like it, but
customer_reviews.text: I bought two different stools. See pic: the other pic is no good. Learniture is decent. I am gonna give it a 4 star because of the seat could be thicker more padding. 3-4 hours on it, your ass won't be happy. I like everything else about this tool. The thicc thicc thicc bottom is actually a nice design; much better than the other product I purchased. I will change the review to 1 star is anything goes wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Bob Davis

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye back pain!
customer_reviews.text: Goodbye back pain! I spend about 5 hours a day on this stool and WOW what a difference it has made for my lower back in the 5 weeks since it arrived. I use it as a leaning stool (both feet on the floor) while I work. I love the adjustable height and the swivel action, which is perfect for my L-shaped workspace. The seat is padded enough to provide comfort, and it cleans easily. I have it on a carpeted surface, and I've had no problems with it slipping. What a difference this little stool has made in my life - worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An alternative to the office chair.
customer_reviews.text: A regular office chair only caused more leg pain since I suffer from peripheral neuropathy in my legs from a bout of Lyme disease. The neuropathy is a residual condition from the meds that were used to kill the spirochete of LD. In any case, this stool alleviates the many pressure points from sitting in a chair. The stool allows my legs to be in many different positions, unlike an office chair, which offers only one or two positions for my legs to extend. It swivels and never falls over and has a most comfortable cushion seat to sit on. Yes, it's a little pricey but comfort has a price. It is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DIGITALSHOOTER

customer_reviews.title: I believe it is giving me an easy way to get passive exercise for my whole body
customer_reviews.text: I am 81 and was looking for a passive core exercise device. I just sit on this and wobble around while I am watching television. I believe it is giving me an easy way to get passive exercise for my whole body. I noticed that every muscle in my body had a slight ache after my first day of use. I of course over used it. Now I just sit on it for about 2 hours a day. I love it because I seem to be in constant motion. I do not feel guilt about sitting and watching TV for several hours an evening. I also use it for several hours a day as a computer chair.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Gym life to Desk life!
customer_reviews.text: I was in the fitness industry for so long and constantly moving. I got a desk job 2 years ago and I now sit 8 hours a day and I hate it!!! My body is trashed from sitting for long periods till I remember a gym I worked at had a similar stool and I bought it..... you’ll never be comfortable at your desk again lol it forces your to sit up straight and constantly move your body I find my self standing up more and moving around the office! Best investment!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great with treadmill desk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my treadmill desk and it is perfect. I am 5' 7" and it works great for sitting and leaning. It definitely supports my full-sized/adult weight (it is not just a kid's school stool). I keep it at full height, but it is very easy to adjust. Assembly was a snap (literally). I do find it necessary to use a foot stool when sitting -- I just use a plastic step stool that my kids had used in the bathroom when they were little.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard and bad on the back
customer_reviews.text: I sat in one of these chairs but it was an expensive one made for back support and core. This chair is sturdy and not cheaply made but it feels like a knock off of what the product is supposed to do. The seat is way too firm that it hurts the butt and back. I am not sure if part of the problem is that the base is too solid if that makes sense. The thought behind it is great and there are chairs out there that actually work, but as an adult beware of your back. I don't feel this particular chair in my core either.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: I liked the concept
customer_reviews.text: I liked the concept, the lack of seat allows the product to be easily stored. I got this because I was a yoga ball at work, but don't have enough room for a huge ball when I work from home. I wish the bottom was more bouncy like a yoga ball, or maybe more round so you had to focus on balancing on it a little more? The stool height has a pretty good range, but I wish it could go a tad bit shorter and higher. Overall, I love the product, much better than a chair and am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Micromovement all day
customer_reviews.text: I usually switch between standing and leaning, but I do take this chair with me to other parts of the office to sit on for long meetings. I'm 5'7", and I would not want to lean on this in the standing position if I were any taller. Since I can lean on it comfortably at full extension, it pulls double duty when lowering to chair height. The wobble is great, keeps me moving all day long. I will say that I still don't use it for more than 4 hours, as my butt does start to get sore. It might be the 45° angle and the desire to slip, but I would say that the stool is adequately padded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not bad...pricey for what it is...but good quality...
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is - easy to install, no tools required at all. I'm 6' and with the seat fully extended it's very comfortable for me. I use it with my standing desk and it works great. Quality is good, the seat is a nylon like material so pretty slick but you don't slide around much. The base is a rubbery plastic, stays put. The seat is a shock system so with it extended at all you can sorta bounce up and down like a pogo stick. That's not a bad thing as it's probably more comfortable with it moving a little like that. I'm happy with the purchase and will definitely get good use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: KenJr

customer_reviews.title: Secure, engaging, flexible heights
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people I’m working from home for too many hours a day. This stool lets me sit at desk height or lean from a standing position. It feels secure yet allows me to engage several muscle groups while leaning and wobbling. It was easy to assemble and secure on the floor. It was also one of the more affordable options. I’ll be using it for ukulele practice and TV watching to increase muscle engagement. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: QuickShopper

customer_reviews.title: Too hard!
customer_reviews.text: Nice seat. However the cushion is just too hard. I really wanted to like but it just hurt my tushi. I'm returning it. Love Amazon for its rtn policy.
customer_reviews.author: Readie

customer_reviews.title: Great stool with one weird problem
customer_reviews.text: This stool is exactly what I was looking for. The reason I took stars off though is because I’m pretty sure it arrived bent. The plastic that you attach under the stool’s seat prevents you from lowering it completely because it hits the ridge of the pneumatic cylinder. I know the plastic bit is on correctly because it snaps in place, so I’m thinking the piston(?) or plastic under the seat is bent causing it to hit at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: keepfrozen

customer_reviews.title: Hot seat!
customer_reviews.text: This stool is almost perfect! Strong, sturdy, easy to adjust, great looking. However, the top is vinyl (that's clear in the description). Any use over 3 minutes creates a hot, sweaty backside, like sitting on a hot car seat before they were fabric. I haven't found a solution. I may have to macrame a rope cover. Cannot recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jody D.

customer_reviews.title: Helps fix your posture and break bad habits!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, at first I thought it was too stiff, but after months of use, the stiffness is what I love most. It makes me conscious of how I am sitting and how long I am sitting. It is actually quite comfortable (keep trying different rotations, you'll find the sweet spot!) and it reminds me to sit up right and take breaks when it starts to be uncomfortable. That right there is worth the purchase alone! Have someone that always comes to your office but you don't want to stay too long? Possible solution. ;-) The stool is very durable and you don't have to worry about it deflating like alternative ball stools.
customer_reviews.author: singingpalmtree

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS STOOL!!! I am a "stander" and don't like sitting in normal size/height chairs. I am 5'2" and prefer cocktail height tables and stools. This product fits the bill for comfort, ease of use, movability, alignment for my back...and for cuteness because it is Red :)
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Godsend
customer_reviews.text: We finally found a desk chair for a child who constantly tips chairs backwards (and falls). This weeble wobbles but it doesn't fall over. We tried the inflatable ball chair, but our child popped it (on purpose). This is indestructible and perfect for an extremely fidgety person. It provides lots of leg resistance and core engagement. It is highly adjustable over a big range of heights. We are so happy we found this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money.
customer_reviews.text: Good concept but not so great strategic planning and construction. I have an adjustable standing desk and thought this would be perfect. Nope. Can only partially lean (base needs some kind of grippers, too slippery) and it puts a little too much pressure on your tailbone. Made my back pain worse. If the base was heavier and flat against the floor, and the shaft moved from within/inside the base/anchor instead of a rounded, rocking base, it would be much more effective. I tried it for a couple of weeks, different height levels, different positions, but it wasn't effective at what it's supposed to do. Wish I could return it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: V@AmazonV

customer_reviews.title: Helps the old teacher stay awake
customer_reviews.text: Can't say the same for my students. Some days, admit it, we teachers just need a little sit down. My colleagues saw me bring this in for only my use (high schoolers are not mature enough to have them, I caught them laying on their stomachs on it and pretending like they were planes, 18 year olds, I tell you!). Two other teachers have purchased these after sitting on mine. I am so proud to bring joy to my friends. The best stool to sit on and it keeps me awake when I get tired of the sound of my own voice.
customer_reviews.author: KTKT

customer_reviews.title: Fix the instructions
customer_reviews.text: When you assemble this...don't we assemble everything? There is a black...collar that must come out for this thing to attach. It doesn't say that anywhere in the instructions. It's hard to get off too. It looks like part of the chair. I would have sent it back. However, my neighbor was over, he's a handy guy. I was going to send it back. We decided that we thought it was broken already so what's a little more broken...can't use it. He took that black doo dah off and the thing snapped right into place. I like the wiggle factor.
customer_reviews.author: Creed

customer_reviews.title: I have yet to find a clothing option where I don't feel like I'm going to slide off
customer_reviews.text: I have used this stool for over a year now, 5 days a week. Some days I sit all day, some days I stand/lean all day. My ONLY CON about this product is the upholstery material. I have yet to find a clothing option where I don't feel like I'm going to slide off. Once I get my perfect angle, my core is engaged (engaged - not holding on for dear life), I can stay for a bit before fear of falling overwhelms me. Other than that -- I LOVE THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia P.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!  Everything I hoped it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is easy to assemble, easy to height-adjust, easy to swap between sit and stand-and-lean, easy to nudge aside for straight standing ... it allows me to rock, lean, sit still -- allowing me to flex my legs, engage my core or support my full weight. Because it's so compact and attractive, it wouldn't be in the way if I added an under-desk treadmill. And yes, it's attractive and sturdy. I am so very happy with this stool, and look forward to using it to help me adopt healthier working habits.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I love the effect if being able to lean my whole seat to and from thr areas where my craft parts are on my table. Comfy and can respond to my 3 special needs dogs in a hurry. Best seat ever. I struggled putting other brand together but this was easier. This one is a little lighter & shorter than the Engage, which of course I could put together after success with this one. Feels good to sit, yet be able to move around or arise quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Susan the Grouch

customer_reviews.title: Back Pain Gone!
customer_reviews.text: Like many people, I'm working from home these days. My old Ikea desk chair was not adjustable and became really uncomfortable very quickly. SO - I moved to the couch. Comfy in the moment - horrible for your back over time. I started having some real back pain and difficulty straightening up by the end of the day. This stool has been AMAZING. Looks great. Super easy to assemble. Pain in the butt (literally) the first few days while I got used to it - but since then, it's been GREAT. No more back pain. I know my posture has improved. I don't feel the need to stretch and "recover" when I'm done with work for the day.
customer_reviews.author: G-zelle

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made but not as comfortable as I had hoped. I'm still trying to figure out how to comfortably sit on for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Cachirulo Milonguero

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This stool was incredibly easy to assemble and feels heavy and durable. It's very stable to sit on - aside from the rocking motion of course. It takes a bit of getting used to, and I've only been using it for about a week. So far I really like it. I'm alternating sitting, leaning, and standing at my adjustable desk. If I sit too long I can definitely feel it in my tailbone, but that just serves as a good reminder that it's time to change position.
customer_reviews.author: MissFern

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with quality and options
customer_reviews.text: I am "princess and the chair" at work. Nothing suits me for an entire 8+ hour day but this stool gives me a few good options in concert with my adjustable desk. So I can sit low for a few hours, raise my desk and the stool and sit in another position, or stand at my desk and just kind of lean my butt on the stool. I also have a regular office chair handy in case I want to slouch but am using that less and less, the more i get used to this. And it does take some getting used to. You're using muscles and your spine in a different way. So be patient.
customer_reviews.author: SilverGirl

customer_reviews.title: Love it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is adjustable. I use it at my adjustable standing desk and adjust the stool too. Sometimes I wish it would go taller and I am only 5'6. Also, my rear starts to hurt when I am standing/leaning against it, but I consider that a sign that it is time to stand back up and stop leaning. It's pretty stable, I've never fallen or knocked it over and I am a klutz. I even perch on it on my knees sometimes. I also sit and spin on it for fun or find myself rocking on it while working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Going back
customer_reviews.text: Tried to make this work. Like this chair comfortable works for me. Gas cylinder defective (?) two weeks ownership. Parts "back ordered." Want to resolve issue before return date expires but their customer service unable to make that happen. Lots of going back and fourth with them seems like they are disorganized. Reluctantly sending chair back will buy one from company with better customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Guns Save Lives

customer_reviews.title: After Challenging Assembly, Grew to LOVE This Stool!
customer_reviews.text: At first, the plastic that goes over the top part of the pole didn't fit so I had to shave some plastic off inside of the cover to make it work. Once I put it together and after using it for awhile, I fell in love with this stool. It's comfortable and fits perfectly in my tiny apartment/home corner office. Also, whenever I have people over, they love it. It seems to be a perfect seat for those who can't sit still. LOL. Fun little ergonomic stool! I'm also glad I got it when it was under $100.
customer_reviews.author: @arabelladelucco

customer_reviews.title: This is a great wobble chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wobble chair. Takes a bit of getting use to, but I bought one for my child and myself. Keeps him busy as he sits at the computer, which helps us both alleviate computer sitting stiffness. Just take the time to let your body adjust from a regular chair...
customer_reviews.author: DorothyofOz

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, not a lot of parts to assemble. This chair is not tall enough for a standing desk, but for a regular desk it will do just fine. Quality of the product seems great, but the chair takes a few days to get used to. I like to switch between my regular chair and this chair every few hours. I feel like my lower back pain has gotten better with this product, and it’s nice to have more mobility for my hips.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good base weight makes this outstanding as a desk chair
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. The base weight is really good so the stool has some intertia and moves predictably when I go to sit down. The springy seat post is a nice feature too. And there is a groove around the underside of the seat that makes it easy to grab and lift the stool when you want to move it. If you have a really sensitive back, this might be more weight than you want to drag around.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. West

customer_reviews.title: Love this stool
customer_reviews.text: I love this stool. I have been using for a month now and it really reminds me that to sit up straight. You can still slouch on it but this works much better than the lumbar pillows and ergonomic chairs I think. The reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I wish it went just another inch lower. I have it at the lowest and still need to put my monitor on a riser. I'm 5'2. Also, I wish they were a little more economical...no doubt it is expensive but worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lethal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use right away
customer_reviews.text: Takes *literally* longer to unbox it than to assemble it - less than 3 minutes. Still figuring out exactly the best way to sit - (i.e. should I aim to sit perfectly perpendicular to the floor (90 degree angle) or slightly tipped towards desk (~75 degree angle)) - but I find it very easy to sit and work without really much thought. I have it on hardwood floors - and find that it slips a little if you tip too far forward or left/right - so I'll be putting something under it with a bit of "grip." Also takes up very little space so it's nice to tuck away.
customer_reviews.author: JFun

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair and standing alternative but don't throw out your old chair
customer_reviews.text: I like this stool. It takes a little getting used to but there are some nice benefits. I'm 5-10 and wish it went a little lower to fit under my 28" table better. It goes high enough for me to use as a break from standing too. Solid and heavy, nice adjustment. Seat is a bit hard. It is very convenient to sit without having to pull a big desk chair back. My elbows like it too as they hang free. I find sometimes though I just want to sit in my cushy office chair.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair! I've had it for 3 days, and it is exactly what I've needed for 2 years! The height adjustment allows me to use my standing OR sitting desk, the rounded bottom allows me to move a bit WITHOUT the chair bumping the walls! AND, when I'm standing without using the chair, I don't trip over it!! It's just heavy enough to stay up-right and in place, but not too heavy to be moved or have it's location adjusted just a smidge. I LOVE THIS CHAIR.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my choice!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this seat! I’ve never used one so it is taking some getting-used-to but I’m very pleased thus far. My two negative remarks are that the seat is a bit slick which causes some issues when trying to position myself, and it is a bit hard which causes some discomfort after using it for an extended period of time. I believe both will be solved as I use it more often and become more familiar with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great stool for Pharmacists!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a Pharmacist and is on her feet all day, working on computers & at a counter. This chair had been a fantastic tool to make her 12 hour shifts less painful. She is 5'3" &110 lbs, this chair works for her & even felt good on my 6'2", 200 lb body. It will take a few minutes to get comfortable using this, but once mastered, it will help reduce the load on your body.
customer_reviews.author: Lowcountry LawMan

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea of leaning/not really sitting but in practice ...
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable, I guess that it was meant to be. Could really use more padding on the seat. Base is stable though, so if you have rock hard glutes it might work. I like the idea of leaning/not really sitting but in practice I do not use it at all because it hurts my butt.
customer_reviews.author: MaryBethP

customer_reviews.title: The chair is awesome, except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this stool, a lot. But I find that over long periods of time even just half seated the concave design of the chair breeds discomfort. If the seat had a dome-shaped pad it would be much more comfortable. Overall, if you are light and only use these things in short spats its a great stool. But for the marathon coder needs a bit more concave padding.
customer_reviews.author: Tenderoni

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth every penny. I have a hurt back, but I'm also relatively fit. After 9 months of PT I'm finally starting to normalize and this is by far the most comfortable chair I've had the chance to use. I have tried everything from kneeling chairs, standing desks, and this is a really happy medium. I love it. For reference I'm 5'11" and 180. This thing can probably seat someone that is 6'4" comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: BenjaminButcher

customer_reviews.title: Why the base is so Heavy?
customer_reviews.text: The base wights a lot, I had similar ones in plastic which weight 80% less. Assembly size, the conical upper plastic which attaches to the seat from below took some force to insert, they don't explain well that it requires some force (doesn't "screw" as one might think). Functionally wise, it does the job well. It is not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Liberating, attractive and well made
customer_reviews.text: I hate being stuck indoors, but this chair gives be a feeling of exercising and freedom even at my desk. I am an active person so I did not feel tired from using it as some of the reviews mentioned, but I did feel liberated. It went together easily, came quickly and looks nice in our office. It seems sturdy and well made. It also feels secure to sit on, not unstable at all. So far I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! Really helps with my posture. Small footprint, so you can move to the side if you don't need it. Great for a standing desk/treadmill combo as you can put the stool on top of the treadmill when you want to sit and not stand. Good construction. Best of all, it is half the price of the competition without compromising quality. Thank you Learniture.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley25

customer_reviews.title: Gas lift failed after a month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a little over a month ago. Comfy, adjustable. It was great, until the gas mechanism in the middle failed and it wouldn't maintain height. I reached out to customer service, they sent me a replacement part without instructions. When I asked about disassembly instructions, they replied that, in fact, the stool could not be disassembled once put together. Reached out to Amazon and have a replacement. I'll update if this one lasts a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Kalmbach

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable, but definitely the cheapest
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a standing desk at work. As others have noted, it's not the most comfortable to sit on, but that actually encourages me to switch between standing and sitting more often. I had some issues jamming the plastic part onto the seat, but after about twenty minutes, finally got it on. Overall, it's not the highest quality or best chair, but I wasn't able to find anything else anywhere near this price-range for this type of seat and it fills my needs.
customer_reviews.author: ZToaster

customer_reviews.title: A Standing Break for the Office
customer_reviews.text: We have many sit-stand desks in the office and I like standing, most of the time. I wanted to be able to have something that I could take a break and sit if I wanted, but still be "standing" at my desk. I also wanted something that was good for my posture and core so I wasn't inclined to slouch. I got two of these to test and have since ordered four more, everyone LOVES them. A great solution for the "vari-desk" up/down problem. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Strategic Thinking

customer_reviews.title: Add a new dimension to your work space
customer_reviews.text: I'm love this tilting stool as it provides support when I tire of simply standing at my variable height desk and I don't want to sit in a chair. The 'active learning' part allows my body to move easily in different directions, increasing flexibility when I'm at my desk for many hours. The weighted base of the stool provides stability and facilitates stretching. I find I have better posture when using the stool than sitting still in a chair hunched towards a computer screen. Kudos to the designers! These are not just for kids working at low tables!
customer_reviews.author: jluther

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: This stool was recommended by my chiropractor, so I had high hopes for it. I am 5’7”, and the stool never seemed tall enough for me. The seat was hard plastic, and very uncomfortable. I gave myself 2 weeks to get used to it, but ultimately returned it. Getting it disassembled to fit back into the box is difficult. I couldn’t do it alone.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the 1 star reviews!
customer_reviews.text: So, in general, when I want to buy something on Amazon I look for high reviews and how many people have bought the item. After that I look at the negative reviews. Usually I can tell if someone has a real gripe or is a general Negative Nancy type of disgruntalled buyer. And I choose to buy or not to buy accordingly. Well, in this case the 1 star raters are right. This stool hurt my back and butt in less than 5 minutes. Your mileage may vary folks.... I regret not saving up the $ for a Swopper stool.
customer_reviews.author: david demichelis

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Stool
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stool. However, on March 9, 2020, it cost $98.84. The price jumped over 50% a few days later. It now costs $152. I was going to buy two more. Not anymore! I can understand a 10% price increase but not over 50% overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Gill JR

customer_reviews.title: Love this little toadstool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cute & functional stool! Having 3 places to adjust the height is convenient, and I love being able to move around while I'm working at my desk. The stool is solidly constructed, and looks like it will hold up to daily use. The vinyl cover looks like leather, and seems quite durable. I have only had the stool for a week, and it does take some getting used to - puts more pressure on my lower buttocks, but encourages a healthier sitting position.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Sonne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic chair
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chair. I have a standing desk at work. Allows me to stand, lean, sit. I find it comfortable to be able to stand or lean or sit when I want. Not to stand all day, and not to sit all day. Like it enough, that I bought another for my home desk. People at my work have tried it out and they will be getting one as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: What a cool toy for my home office/studio
customer_reviews.text: I tried several chairs to balance seating with my standing desk with not much luck. And then came this cool toy - I LOVE IT. Super easy to assemble. Comfortable cushion (takes a couple of days to get use to it as you learn to negotiate the shape, your posture and the stool height and distance from the desk). Sturdy - well made, and heavy enough to stay in place when you swivel. Curve base allows for good range of motion - especially good for long days. I love how the backless design and curve base creates natural motion that keeps muscle fresh and blood. I also use it to play my piano. flowing. I am 5'8", 170lb
customer_reviews.author: Héctor A. Burgos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our standup desks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these for our office and found this make and model to be the preferred choice for everyone here. They are sturdy, easily adjustable and very stable. I did purchase similar items from a different manufacturer that while extremely similar were not as adjustable or as nice. So I would go with this choice again.
customer_reviews.author: Divecon

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This chair works and I like it. I have to change chairs and use a standing desk intermittently. This is highly maneuverable, and unfortunately it can slip out from beneath you. I have to pay attention so I don't fall off of it. (So far, I haven't fallen.) I would still buy it again because it helps my back.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be taller.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't go high enough for taller people. I'm 5'8" and need it to go about 3 inches taller for a nice leaning chair. I wish they had taller ones, the seat top is a very durable vinyl and the height adjustment buttons are quickly found underneath the seat. If they had taller units then I would buy three more.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Good function
customer_reviews.text: Pros: solid base and adequate seat padding, triangle shape seat facilitates upright posture, reasonable price cons: the plastic tube in assembly step 1 (supposed to be installed under the seat) is not sized correctly, could not be pushed or screwed onto the seat base. Fortunately it did not impact the height adjustment, seems to be just a cosmetic piece. If not for this I'd give 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Strengthens core and helps posture
customer_reviews.text: A piece was broken, my husband superglued it and it was fine. Didn’t bother to return the whole thing over something that could be fixed. Works great for me and my husband. We are both fit but not the best posture so this helps us a lot. Helps strengthen your core too. We are 5”3’ and 5”7’ so it a good height for both..may not work for others though
customer_reviews.author: Robin's Nest

customer_reviews.title: Not Comfortable At All
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this chair. I have a problem with my hips that causes me a lot of pain if I sit for a long time. Kneeling chairs work great for me for a while and I thought that this would allow me to have an even greater angle at my hips, and it did... but I could only sit for about 30 minutes before my butt really started to ache. It's built well though. FYI: I'm about 6'2" 220lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Possible Fractured arm and two accidents day 1.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a home school computer lab at home. My kid and myself both went backwards without even trying and landed hard on the floor. We may have a fractured arm due to the fall. LIke the idea, but the safety issue with a slight tip backwards is not worth this ridiculous price.
customer_reviews.author: JSmith

customer_reviews.title: Great office chair
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this “chair” for a few months now and I am really enjoying it. It’s easy to move around my own office or even to a co workers office with just one hand. I feel like it is helping my core and posture, which is why I got it and it did take some getting use to. I think it is much better and sturdier than using a gym ball and I think it is more professional looking.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler T. Lazarian

customer_reviews.title: Cleverly made chair with too hard seat cushion
customer_reviews.text: This is a cleverly well-made chair, but the cushion really is too hard. So I used it for a few weeks and then found myself switching to my regular office chair, and now I just use my regular chair and this one sits there unused. Oh well. Learn something new every day.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept of this stool
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this stool, but was disappointed with the quality for the amount I paid. A piece of the plastic is a bit askew making it difficult to lower the stool to it's lowest point. It's possible, just not the smooth raise and lower I would expect—it's all assembled—to take apart and return seems like a hassle so I've decided to live with it. I'm hoping with repeated use it might straighten itself out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not ideal for someone who is taller
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'7" and it adjusts high enough for me. If you have longer legs (female) or are tall then the seat might not go high enough for you when you want to be in a "standing" leaning position. Great stool overall. I like that the base is low profile, doesn't take up a lot of room since I am using it in a confined space.
customer_reviews.author: George B

customer_reviews.title: Too tall for standard 29" desk
customer_reviews.text: The lowest position for this stool is too high for a standard 29" desk. This is probably an amazing stool if you have a higher or standing desk that can take on various heights. However, if you are at an old school desk you'll find yourself having to hunch over to work at your keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hartsig

customer_reviews.title: Helps Strengthen Core
customer_reviews.text: I love this item! It can be used if you have a standing desk, which I don't, but I use it at my traditional desk. This item helps me keep my back straight, no sloughing, and shoulders back. I do not have pain in my shoulders like I did with a traditional office chair. I need to get one for our home office. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Love this stool
customer_reviews.text: I use this at my sit-stand desk so that I can easily move from standing to sitting. The adjustability works well. The stool keeps my posture active. My co-workers like to borrow it when I'm not in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Lilnova

customer_reviews.title: No wobbles here! Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This! I love this wobble stool. I tend to end up curled up in a ball in my big ol' desk chair or plopping my feet up on the desk. Neither of these are good for my spine or conducive to work. This has helped my posture, my core, my energy. I haven't fallen off one time, either. It was very easy to put together, a little heavy, but I really love it. Did I mention how much I love it?
customer_reviews.author: Glynnis Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Seat fell off, I fell down. Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The worthless instructions tell you to remove the orange cap. There was no orange cap, but a white one which I tried to remove with pliers, but it didn't come off. I then put the seat on the shaft as instructed and sat down, only to have the seat fall of the shaft causing me to fall down. What a piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.author: S. Gensler

customer_reviews.title: Great for People that Don’t Like to Sit Still!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stool. I can easily sit still or move while sitting on it. It has a heavy base that gives it stability. It’s great for adults but may be dangerous for some kids that are not mature enough to not play on it. I love that the height is adjustable. I put a pair of these stools at my kitchen counter but always warn people that aren’t familiar with the stool; if your not expecting it to wobble you may fall off.
customer_reviews.author: R Elizagaray

customer_reviews.title: Great stool, could use more padding.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stool. It is very sturdy and it was easy to assemble. It's a bit difficult to move around because of the heavy bottom and it doesn't have wheels / coasters on it. The only thing I don't like is the hard seat so I will be looking for some type of cushion for it but all in all I really enjoy it. Plan on purchasing another for my other desk.
customer_reviews.author: justMeLat

customer_reviews.title: Great help for those with back pain.
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to stand very long making some types of housework difficult. I bought this for use at the kitchen sink and couldn’t be happier. This has helped me tremendously- so much so that I just purchased another. Great product with endless uses.
customer_reviews.author: S Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Stool but needs to be bit more higher
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Stool. Padding could have been better. For people above 5 10 , it might be small. With Standup desk you do need a stool with right height. I am thnking of adding extra padding on top to make it 2 to 3 inches high.
customer_reviews.author: Shree Menon

customer_reviews.title: Why not 5 stars?
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble, but the instructions were terrible, and it adjusts easy once assembled. My big gripe that I didn't expect is that shape of the seat actually causes my legs to fall asleep regardless of whether I'm leaning or sitting :(
customer_reviews.author: Rich Fall

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I can also quickly move it around ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a drum throne. Love it. I can also quickly move it around the music room to sit at keyboard or play my guitar in the other corner. Giving it 4 stars because one of the adjustment levers (there are 3) busted after I put the base on. To much hassle to take apart and ship back. Living with the defect. Doesn't affect comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Sniperboy360

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how it got so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough padding in center so the hard plastic hits under our legs and they go numb. Not sure how it got so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great benefits...
customer_reviews.text: The chair is great for learning to keep your body from melting into an office chair. Takes some getting used to but works really well with my stand-up desk. May not be for tall people but I'm only 5'2". My husband is 6'3" and I think he would be able to use it leaning, but he can definitely use it sitting. Make the investment in your body
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Working from home has it's bottom
customer_reviews.text: Working from home I quickly learned how stiff my joints can get sitting in a dining room chair. This funky chair helped bring some relief to my backend. It takes some getting used to but it is now my go to seat for working at the computer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Worded

customer_reviews.title: Good for core workout but not too comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The chair is good definitely makes me use my core to be stable the only negative is the chair could use more cushion I can get sore sitting on it for extended periods of time. The chair can go very high and very low this is using the lowest height on my sit stand desk
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Used at Veterinary clinic and we all love them
customer_reviews.text: These seats are quite easy to be on for a few hours, are easy to move, quite stable, adjustable and take up almost ZERO floor space, which is why we use them at the Vet Clinic. In our small and crowded space, you can grab this seat with one hand and carry it to another room or location without making people step back or clearing doorways. Get this!
customer_reviews.author: N. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This seat is perfect for a person that needs to move around more, but is at a desk all day. I put this in my office and had back pain relief after just one day of use. Highly recommend. The seat is just a tad uncomfortable as it is a triangle shape with no form fit, but I still highly recommend. Takes up way less space than a ball and looks better.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Streit

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stool, and this is the second one I've ordered, but it arrived damaged. (Shipping box and packaging was all fine, but this bit fell out when I unwrapped it.) It's still usable but it's a bummer that they sent it this way.
customer_reviews.author: KBN

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, harder than a rock
customer_reviews.text: The ability to lean / extend high / etc is great. Easy to put together and very rugged. Seat top is like sitting on a bag full of volcanic rocks. it is incredibly firm and has very little padding to speak of, so it is very uncomfortable for anything more than a 5 minute sit. Will likely make some modifications.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little adjustment but overall very nice stool.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little while to get used to this stool but now I love it. I have another stool that is similar in idea but different in implementation. I like this one better. I do wish it had wheels so I could roll it from one spot to another because it's kind of awkward. But it probably wouldn't be very stable for leaning if it did. Overall, I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ploni

customer_reviews.title: Learniture
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 of these. Adults and kids alike find it comfortable. On the heavy side compared to plastic wobble chairs so our younger kids need help moving them. One seat cushion is tearing. If I had to buy again, I might go with lighter, less expensive, height adjustable plastic versions but at the time of purchase this was one of the few that would ship to AK/HI.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. The buttons to raise and lower it are under all three corners and are easy enough to use for someone with slightly weaker hands. Very happy with the quality. The plastic shield that attaches under the seat before attaching the metal pneumatic gas lift was difficult to snap into place, but nothing hubby with a block of wood and a mallet couldn’t fix. Definitely considering purchasing a second one as hubby is also a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to think
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot heavier than I expected. The instructions are clear at least, although there was no "orange cap" on the pole to remove. The grey sleeve does not stay in place, nor does the top part with the seat - if I want to move the stool forward or backward, and I lift it, the seat comes away from the pole every time. It doesn't adjust up or down either. The seat is comfortable enough, but I'm not sure this is safe to sit on since it comes apart so easily.
customer_reviews.author: C. Polacek

customer_reviews.title: Fun alternative to a normal chair
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I have a standing / treadmill desk and needed a seat to use for when I need to take a quick break. Very flexible and fun. I just wish the seat cushion was a little softer and that it went a few inches taller. Other than that I am happy I bought it and would rebuy it if I had to. For reference I'm 5'6 so if you are taller than me it might be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbo

customer_reviews.title: Seat material could be better
customer_reviews.text: I've used this stool for a week and for the most part, I'm satisfied with it. However, there is one thing that could be improved upon and that is the material used on the seat. The seat material is not conducive for leaning against. I have to keep adjusting my position or I'll slip off the seat if I'm leaning against my stool.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great core stool
customer_reviews.text: I either stand for hours on end or sit for hours on end at work, neither is good for you. With this I can switch it up to a good core workout while somewhat sitting. It's great to take load off feet and lower back but this is not a comfort stool, it is active sitting. Other people at my job love it and someone already bought themselves one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Meyer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Hi, We bought this stool for our son who needs help strengthening his core and improve his posture. This was recommended by his therapists. It's just been over a month and something sharp is poking out of the stool (pictures attached) and scratched my son's hand. It is also tearing the stool cover. Very disappointed with the quality. It is past the return window but would like to return or replace it as it is not usable at this time.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stool for my work station. I am currently teaching from home and needed a stool I could sit in for extended hours. This stool improves my posture and relieves fatigue while I work. I really like that is is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: MaryL

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Setup was super fast and easy. No tools. It's light weight, easy to relocate, easy to adjust. The best thing is I felt my core engage immediately. It keeps me moving constantly. It also keeps me from sitting too long. I'm never static. Very comfortable and relieved the pain I had in my leg from sitting. I feel
customer_reviews.author: Girl vs

customer_reviews.title: Tank chair
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend the cash as opposed to the other chairs but I'm glad I did, things a tank. My daughter uses it daily and she is a whirlwind of chaos that has destroyed more than her fair share of chairs. But this thing hasn't been phased by her rein of destruction. Only reason I gave 4 starts on ease to assemble and portability is because its heavy and did require a little extra to push the seat on the post but I expect that from something it heavy. Also my 250 lbs husband can sit on it and it has NO issues.
customer_reviews.author: trisha nyeste

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This stool is perfect for my needs. I tend to never lean back in chairs and I wiggle a lot (ADHD). It gives me just the right amount of "wobble" but it doesn't slip. I was worried that it would maybe mark my wood floor but no such thing happened. Very easy to put together - it took about 5 minutes to assemble. Love the red seat color!
customer_reviews.author: 10plusyearsonamazon

product_meta.title: Learniture Adjustable-Height Active Learning Stool, Red, LNT-RIA3052RD-SO
product_meta.description: Color:RedLearniture’s Adjustable-Height Active Learning Stool features a non-slip curved base with a wide range of motion so even the most energetic can stay focused The vinyl-covered polyurethane seat is comfortable and the backless design encourages proper posture while strengthening core muscles The polypropylene frame is easy to clean and a lightweight design makes mobility and storage simple This height-adjustable stool accommodates people of various sizes
feature_bullets: Easy-to-use pneumatic gas lift adjusts the seat height from 18 1/2 to 28 inches.
The non-slip, curved base features a wide range of motion.Weight Capacity:265 Pounds
Backless design encourages proper posture while strengthening core muscles.
The 12 5/8"-wide seat is constructed from easy-to-clean vinyl-covered foam.
Lightweight design for easy mobility and storage.
Seat Material: Polyurethane molded foam w/ vinyl upholstery

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
